720p is not BR.

To the guy asking why it's 1280x544:

Because it's letterboxed.  If you were playing a 720p copy on your TV, it would be 1280x720, but the black bars on the top and bottom of the picture count towards that.  When people rip letterboxed movies, they crop out the black bars to save on file size.  So, in essence, you are still seeing the exact same resolution on the image, just without black bars included.

So, one could argue that any 1080p BD that is letterboxed is NOT true 1080p, but we'd laugh at you if you did.
